communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Chair, from September 1, 2024 to September 30, 2024.

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: C182672-051924
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The administrative tracking file for the request C182672-051924, and all e-mail, memoranda, and records of phone calls created in the processing of that request, and related metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Board Resignations, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Under the Illinois FOIA, I am writing to request each CPS Board Member's recent resignation letter OR any and all documents sufficient to show each of their intentions to resign from the CPS Board of Education.

The Board Members in question for the purposes of this FOIA request include the following:

Jianan Shi
Elizabeth Todd Breland
Tanya Woods
Mariela Estrada
Mary Fahey Hughes
Michelle Morales
Rudy Lozano Jr

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Beneficiaries of HAVANA ACT
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the number of all beneficiaries of HAVANA Act since its implementation until October 1, 2024. (HAVANA Act of 2021, Public Law 117-46, 135 Stat. 391 (2021) (codified at 22 U.S.C. 2680b(i))

Please, provide a number of beneficiaries approved since the implementation of the updated rule that became effective on  May 20, 2024 until October 1, 2024 (Implementation of HAVANA Act of 2021, 28 CFR Part 106., JMD Docket No. 157; A.G. Order No. 5922-2024, RIN 1105-AB71).

Please provide demographics for each number of beneficiaries,  such as Federal Agency, age, gender, family members, and the number of children as beneficiaries.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Leonid Ber

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: The Cadet BOV Sept Issue
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The VMI Board of visitors site contains two letters from an alumnus named Mr. Spivey requestion action by the BOV in regard to the student newspaper but no records of any actions taken. I therefore request all and/or all correspondence and other records of any kind sent to and/or received by VMI Board of Visitors President John Adams, former VMI BOV President Thomas Watjen, and/or VMI Supeintendent Cedric Wins sent to or from any person or organization, VMI and/or VMI Alumni Association staff, contractor and/or employees on the subject of The Cadet newspaper as well as any records, correspondence, records, etc. sent to or received from the VMI Alumni Agencies as well as internal VMI records regarding The Cadet newspaper for the period 1 July 2024 to the date of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Court Filings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any notification (with any associated court filings and/or supporting documentation accompanying the notification) received by VMI of:

 a warning/threat of legal action or actual legal action specific to the disciplining of a cadet by VMI leadership.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.
